query: When A and B come into contact with each other, will they mix?

original_scene.description: A is a pot of hot water. B is a pot of cold water. C, D, E, F are four identical cups. G is a bottle of blue pigment. H is a bottle of yellow pigment.

key_step_1.conclusion: Fill C with A and add G, fill D with B and add G, fill E and F with B and add H. Adding G and H makes it easier to see whether A and B are mixed later.

key_step_2.conclusion: Put C on E and D on F. Due to the movement of molecules, H and G in D and F begin to mix with each other. However, due to the high temperature of A and the violent movement of molecules, the density of A is less than that of B, so the H and G in C and E do not mix with each other.

key_step_3.conclusion: Flip C and E over. The density of A in C is less than that of B in E, so it floats up, causing G and H in C and E to mix.

final_scene.annotation: A and B separate when they touch.

subject: thermodynamics
